tables.name: public.model
tables.comment: A fully distinct semantic model, separate from all others.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the domain.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

indexes.name: model_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX model_pkey ON public.model USING btree (model_key)

constraints.name: model_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key)

tables.name: public.domain
tables.comment: A bucket for parts of a model.

columns.name: domain_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this domain is part of.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the domain.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: realized
columns.comment: A realized domain is one with no semantic model, which is preexisting, and just design and later artifacts.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: domain_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX domain_pkey ON public.domain USING btree (model_key, domain_key)

constraints.name: fk_domain_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: domain_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, domain_key)

tables.name: public.subdomain
tables.comment: A bucket for parts of a model.

columns.name: subdomain_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this subdomain is part of.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the subdomain.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: subdomain_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX subdomain_pkey ON public.subdomain USING btree (model_key, subdomain_key)

constraints.name: fk_subdomain_domain
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, domain_key) REFERENCES domain(model_key, domain_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: subdomain_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, subdomain_key)

tables.name: public.domain_association
tables.comment: A semantic relationship between two domains.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this association is part of.

columns.name: association_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: problem_domain_key
columns.comment: The domain that defines requirements for the other.

columns.name: solution_domain_key
columns.comment: The domain that is constrained by the others requirements.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: domain_association_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX domain_association_pkey ON public.domain_association USING btree (model_key, association_key)

constraints.name: fk_association_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_association_problem
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, problem_domain_key) REFERENCES domain(model_key, domain_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_association_solution
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, solution_domain_key) REFERENCES domain(model_key, domain_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: domain_association_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, association_key)

tables.name: public.generalization
tables.comment: A relationship between classes indicating super classes and subclasses. This is also for actors which would also be classes in this case. And for use cases.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this generalization is part of.

columns.name: generalization_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the generalization.

columns.name: is_complete
columns.comment: Are the specializations complete, or can an instantiation of this generalization exist without a specialization.

columns.name: is_static
columns.comment: Are the specializations static and unchanging or can they change during runtime.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: generalization_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX generalization_pkey ON public.generalization USING btree (model_key, generalization_key)

constraints.name: fk_generalization_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: generalization_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, generalization_key)

tables.name: public.actor
tables.comment: A role that a person or sytem can take who uses the system. Actors are outside of subdomains.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this actor is part of.

columns.name: actor_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the actor.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: actor_type
columns.comment: Whether this actor is a person or a system.

columns.name: superclass_of_key
columns.comment: The generalization this actor is a superclass of, if it is one.

columns.name: subclass_of_key
columns.comment: The generalization this actor is a subclass of, if it is one.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: actor_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX actor_pkey ON public.actor USING btree (model_key, actor_key)

constraints.name: fk_actor_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_actor_subclass
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, subclass_of_key) REFERENCES generalization(model_key, generalization_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_actor_superclass
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, superclass_of_key) REFERENCES generalization(model_key, generalization_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: actor_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, actor_key)

tables.name: public.use_case
tables.comment: A sequence of steps in the business rules.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this use case is part of.

columns.name: use_case_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the use case.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: level
columns.comment: How big is the scope of this use case.

columns.name: read_only
columns.comment: When true, this use case changes no state.

columns.name: subdomain_key
columns.comment: The subdomain this use case is part of.

columns.name: superclass_of_key
columns.comment: The generalization this use case is a superclass of, if it is one.

columns.name: subclass_of_key
columns.comment: The generalization this use case is a subclass of, if it is one.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: use_case_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX use_case_pkey ON public.use_case USING btree (model_key, use_case_key)

constraints.name: fk_use_case_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_use_case_subdomain
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, subdomain_key) REFERENCES subdomain(model_key, subdomain_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_use_case_subclass
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, subclass_of_key) REFERENCES generalization(model_key, generalization_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_use_case_superclass
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, superclass_of_key) REFERENCES generalization(model_key, generalization_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: use_case_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, use_case_key)

tables.name: public.use_case_actor
tables.comment: Which actors participate in which use cases.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this use case actor is part of.

columns.name: use_case_key
columns.comment: The use case.

columns.name: actor_key
columns.comment: The actor.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: use_case_actor_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX use_case_actor_pkey ON public.use_case_actor USING btree (model_key, use_case_key, actor_key)

constraints.name: fk_uca_actor
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, actor_key) REFERENCES actor(model_key, actor_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_uca_use_case
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, use_case_key) REFERENCES use_case(model_key, use_case_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: use_case_actor_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, use_case_key, actor_key)

tables.name: public.use_case_shared
tables.comment: Which use cases are used by with other use cases.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this relationship is part of.

columns.name: sea_use_case_key
columns.comment: The higher-level use case.

columns.name: mud_use_case_key
columns.comment: The lower-level use case.

columns.name: share_type
columns.comment: The type of relationship these use cases have.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: use_case_shared_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX use_case_shared_pkey ON public.use_case_shared USING btree (model_key, sea_use_case_key, mud_use_case_key)

constraints.name: fk_shared_mud
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, mud_use_case_key) REFERENCES use_case(model_key, use_case_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_shared_sea
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, sea_use_case_key) REFERENCES use_case(model_key, use_case_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: use_case_shared_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, sea_use_case_key, mud_use_case_key)

tables.name: public.data_type
tables.comment: An data type for use in a class attribute or action parameter.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this data type is part of.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: collection_type
columns.comment: Whether a collection or atomic value, and if a collection what kind.

columns.name: collection_unique
columns.comment: If a collection, is this collection unique.

columns.name: collection_min
columns.comment: If a collection and there is a minimum number of items, the minimum. Always set of maximum set.

columns.name: collection_max
columns.comment: If a collection and there is a maximum number of items, the maximum.

indexes.name: data_type_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX data_type_pkey ON public.data_type USING btree (model_key, data_type_key)

constraints.name: data_type_check
constraints.def: CHECK ((collection_max >= collection_min))

constraints.name: data_type_collection_min_check
constraints.def: CHECK ((collection_min > 0))

constraints.name: fk_data_type_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: data_type_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, data_type_key)

tables.name: public.data_type_atomic
tables.comment: An atomic type that backs a data type for eventually use in a class attribute or action parameter.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this data type is part of.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: The internal ID from data_type.

columns.name: constraint_type
columns.comment: The constraints on values for this data type.

columns.name: reference
columns.comment: If this is a reference, the details that define it.

columns.name: enum_ordered
columns.comment: If this is an enumeration, enumerations could be ordered, so they can be compared greater-lesser-than against each other.

columns.name: object_class_key
columns.comment: If this is an object, which class it is.

indexes.name: data_type_atomic_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX data_type_atomic_pkey ON public.data_type_atomic USING btree (model_key, data_type_key)

constraints.name: fk_atomic_data_type
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: data_type_atomic_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, data_type_key)

tables.name: public.data_type_atomic_enum_value
tables.comment: A value of an attribute that is an enum.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this data type is part of.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: The internal ID from data_type_atomic.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: The enum value.

columns.name: sort_order
columns.comment: A value for keeping presentation clear in documentation. For numbered enums, this is their comparison number.

indexes.name: data_type_atomic_enum_value_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX data_type_atomic_enum_value_pkey ON public.data_type_atomic_enum_value USING btree (model_key, data_type_key, value)

constraints.name: fk_enum_atomic
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type_atomic(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: data_type_atomic_enum_value_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, data_type_key, value)

tables.name: public.data_type_atomic_span
tables.comment: The definition of a span for an atomic data type.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this data type is part of.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: The internal ID from data_type_atomic.

columns.name: lower_type
columns.comment: Whether the lower end of the span is unconstrained, open, or closed.

columns.name: lower_value
columns.comment: The value that defines the lower end of the span.

columns.name: lower_denominator
columns.comment: If the lower bound is a ratio.

columns.name: higher_type
columns.comment: Whether the higher end of the span is unconstrained, open, or closed.

columns.name: higher_value
columns.comment: The value that defines the higher end of the span.

columns.name: higher_denominator
columns.comment: If the higher bound is a ratio.

columns.name: units
columns.comment: The units of this span.

columns.name: precision
columns.comment: The precision of this span. Values in the form of 1.0, 0.1, 0.01, 0.001, etc.

indexes.name: data_type_atomic_span_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX data_type_atomic_span_pkey ON public.data_type_atomic_span USING btree (model_key, data_type_key)

constraints.name: data_type_atomic_span_precision_check
constraints.def: CHECK ((("precision" <= (1)::numeric) AND ("precision" > (0)::numeric) AND (floor(log10("precision")) = log10("precision"))))

constraints.name: fk_span_atomic
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type_atomic(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: data_type_atomic_span_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, data_type_key)

tables.name: public.data_type_field
tables.comment: A field of a record data type.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this data type is part of.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: The internal ID from data_type.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the field within the data type.

columns.name: field_data_type_key
columns.comment: The data type of this field value.

indexes.name: data_type_field_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX data_type_field_pkey ON public.data_type_field USING btree (model_key, data_type_key, name)

constraints.name: fk_field_data_type
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_field_field_data_type
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, field_data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: data_type_field_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, data_type_key, name)

tables.name: public.class
tables.comment: A set of objects that share the same semantics.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this class is part of.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the class.

columns.name: subdomain_key
columns.comment: The subdomain this use case is part of.

columns.name: actor_key
columns.comment: If this class is also an actor, which actor is it.

columns.name: superclass_of_key
columns.comment: The generalization this class is a superclass of, if it is one.

columns.name: subclass_of_key
columns.comment: The generalization this class is a subclass of, if it is one.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: class_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX class_pkey ON public.class USING btree (model_key, class_key)

constraints.name: fk_class_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_class_subdomain
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, subdomain_key) REFERENCES subdomain(model_key, subdomain_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_class_subclass
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, subclass_of_key) REFERENCES generalization(model_key, generalization_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_class_superclass
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, superclass_of_key) REFERENCES generalization(model_key, generalization_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_class_actor
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, actor_key) REFERENCES actor(model_key, actor_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: class_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, class_key)

tables.name: public.attribute
tables.comment: An attribute of a class.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this class attribute is part of.

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this attribute is part of.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the attribute within the class.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: data_type_rules
columns.comment: The rules for a well-formed value.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: If the rules are parsable, the data type they parse into.

columns.name: derivation_policy
columns.comment: If this attribute is derived, the details of the deriviation.

columns.name: nullable
columns.comment: A nullable attribute is one that only humans have to deal with, not software. Should not be used in a sea-level use case. Example: a missing phone number on a contact page.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: attribute_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX attribute_pkey ON public.attribute USING btree (model_key, attribute_key)

constraints.name: fk_attribute_data_type
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_attribute_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: attribute_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, attribute_key)

tables.name: public.class_index
tables.comment: A unique identity for a class, may be mulitple attributes together for the identity.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model the class attribute is part of.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this index is part of.

columns.name: index_num
columns.comment: The specific index this attribute is part of.

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.comment: The attribute that contributes to this index. An attribute can be part of more than one index.

indexes.name: class_index_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX class_index_pkey ON public.class_index USING btree (model_key, class_key, index_num, attribute_key)

constraints.name: fk_index_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_index_attribute
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, attribute_key) REFERENCES attribute(model_key, attribute_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: class_index_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, class_key, index_num, attribute_key)

tables.name: public.association
tables.comment: A semantic relationship between typed instances.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this association is part of.

columns.name: association_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: from_class_key
columns.comment: The away-from direction of the association, for depicting tacochip.

columns.name: from_multiplicity_lower
columns.comment: The multiplicity of the from end of the relation, lower value, 0 means "any".

columns.name: from_multiplicity_higher
columns.comment: The multiplicity of the from end of the relation, higher value, 0 means "any".

columns.name: to_class_key
columns.comment: The toward direction of the association, for depicting tacochip.

columns.name: to_multiplicity_lower
columns.comment: The multiplicity of the to end of the relation, lower value, 0 means "any".

columns.name: to_multiplicity_higher
columns.comment: The multiplicity of the to end of the relation, higher value, 0 means "any".

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The relationship name next to the taco chip.

columns.name: association_class_key
columns.comment: If thiere is a class for for this association, what is it.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: association_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX association_pkey ON public.association USING btree (model_key, association_key)

constraints.name: fk_association_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_association_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, association_class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_association_from
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, from_class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_association_to
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, to_class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: association_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, association_key)

tables.name: public.state
tables.comment: A situation where invariant conditions on a class instance hold.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this state is in.

columns.name: state_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the state in the class.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: state_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX state_pkey ON public.state USING btree (model_key, state_key)

constraints.name: fk_state_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: state_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, state_key)

tables.name: public.event
tables.comment: Some occurence that can potentially trigger a change in and instance.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this event is in.

columns.name: event_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the event in the class.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: parameters
columns.comment: The parameters for the action, alternating parameter name, with how its satified.

indexes.name: event_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX event_pkey ON public.event USING btree (model_key, event_key)

constraints.name: fk_event_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: event_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, event_key)

tables.name: public.guard
tables.comment: An extra condition on when the transition can take place.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this guard is in.

columns.name: guard_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The extra condition on when the transition can take place.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

indexes.name: guard_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX guard_pkey ON public.guard USING btree (model_key, guard_key)

constraints.name: fk_guard_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: guard_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, guard_key)

tables.name: public.action
tables.comment: An action of a class that can be attached to transitions.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this action is part of.

columns.name: action_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the action within the class.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: requires
columns.comment: The requires half of the action contract in TLA+ notation.

columns.name: guarantees
columns.comment: The guarantees half of the action contract in TLA+ notation.

indexes.name: action_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX action_pkey ON public.action USING btree (model_key, action_key)

constraints.name: fk_action_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: action_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, action_key)

tables.name: public.transition
tables.comment: The movement between states.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: transition_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: from_state_key
columns.comment: The state this transition is leaving. If nothing then this is a starting state.

columns.name: event_key
columns.comment: The event triggering the transition.

columns.name: guard_key
columns.comment: If this event has a condition, then what is it.

columns.name: action_key
columns.comment: If this event has an action, then what is it.

columns.name: to_state_key
columns.comment: The state this transition is entering. If nothing then this is a ending state.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: transition_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX transition_pkey ON public.transition USING btree (model_key, transition_key)

constraints.name: fk_transition_from
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, from_state_key) REFERENCES state(model_key, state_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_transition_to
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, to_state_key) REFERENCES state(model_key, state_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_transition_event
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, event_key) REFERENCES event(model_key, event_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_transition_guard
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, guard_key) REFERENCES guard(model_key, guard_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_transition_action
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, action_key) REFERENCES action(model_key, action_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: transition_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, transition_key)

tables.name: public.state_action
tables.comment: An action triggered on entry, exit, or continual do from a state.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: state_key
columns.comment: The state this action is triggered in.

columns.name: state_action_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: action_key
columns.comment: The action triggered.

columns.name: action_when
columns.comment: When the triggere takes place.

indexes.name: state_action_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX state_action_pkey ON public.state_action USING btree (model_key, state_action_key)

constraints.name: fk_state_action_state
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, state_key) REFERENCES state(model_key, state_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_state_action_action
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, action_key) REFERENCES action(model_key, action_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: state_action_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, state_action_key)

tables.name: public.parameter
tables.comment: A parameter of an action.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this state machine is part of.

columns.name: parameter_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: action_key
columns.comment: The action this parameter is part of.

columns.name: data_type_rules
columns.comment: The rules for a well-formed value.

columns.name: data_type_key
columns.comment: If the rules are parsable, the data type they parse into.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The unique name of the parameter within the attribute.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: parameter_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX parameter_pkey ON public.parameter USING btree (model_key, parameter_key)

constraints.name: fk_parameter_data_type
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, data_type_key) REFERENCES data_type(model_key, data_type_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_parameter_action
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, action_key) REFERENCES action(model_key, action_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: parameter_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, parameter_key)

tables.name: public.scenario
tables.comment: A documented scenario, such as a sequence diagram or activity diagram, for a use case.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this scenario is part of.

columns.name: scenario_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The name of the scenario.

columns.name: use_case_key
columns.comment: The use case this scenario is part of.

columns.name: details
columns.comment: A summary description.

columns.name: steps
columns.comment: The structured program steps of the scenario as JSON.

indexes.name: scenario_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX scenario_pkey ON public.scenario USING btree (model_key, scenario_key)

constraints.name: fk_scenario_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_scenario_use_case
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, use_case_key) REFERENCES use_case(model_key, use_case_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: scenario_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, scenario_key)

tables.name: public.scenario_object
tables.comment: An object that participates in a scenario.

columns.name: model_key
columns.comment: The model this scenario object is part of.

columns.name: scenario_object_key
columns.comment: The internal ID.

columns.name: scenario_key
columns.comment: The scenario this object is part of.

columns.name: object_number
columns.comment: Where this object is drawn in the diagram.

columns.name: name
columns.comment: The name of the scenario object.

columns.name: name_style
columns.comment: How the name is displayed in the diagram.

columns.name: class_key
columns.comment: The class this scenario object is an instance of.

columns.name: multi
columns.comment: If true, this object represents many instances of the class (a collection).

columns.name: uml_comment
columns.comment: A comment that appears in the diagrams.

indexes.name: scenario_object_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX scenario_object_pkey ON public.scenario_object USING btree (model_key, scenario_object_key)

indexes.name: scenario_object_model_key_scenario_key_object_number_key
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX scenario_object_model_key_scenario_key_object_number_key ON public.scenario_object USING btree (model_key, scenario_key, object_number)

constraints.name: fk_scenario_object_model
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key) REFERENCES model(model_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_scenario_object_class
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, class_key) REFERENCES class(model_key, class_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: fk_scenario_object_scenario
constraints.def: FOREIGN KEY (model_key, scenario_key) REFERENCES scenario(model_key, scenario_key) ON DELETE CASCADE

constraints.name: scenario_object_pkey
constraints.def: PRIMARY KEY (model_key, scenario_object_key)

constraints.name: scenario_object_model_key_scenario_key_object_number_key
constraints.def: UNIQUE (model_key, scenario_key, object_number)
